intro: Helogyne tacaquirensis, commonly known as the Tacaquirensis helogyne, is a flowering plant native to Venezuela. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
